name: The DISCIPLINARY BOARD OF the SUPREME COURT OF RHODE ISLAND, Petitioner, v. Robert T. FLYNN, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Disciplinary Board of the Supreme Court of Rhode Island v. Flynn

parties: The DISCIPLINARY BOARD OF the SUPREME COURT OF RHODE ISLAND, Petitioner, v. Robert T. FLYNN, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
On May 5, 1980, this Court’s Disciplinary Counsel filed a petition setting forth that respondent, Robert T. Flynn, a member of the Bar of this State had been transferred to inactive status by our order entered April 21, 1980. The petitioner requested this Court appoint substitute counsel for Robert T. Flynn, pursuant to our Rule 42-18(a), in the matter of the estate of Annie Hulme. Joseph B. Carty is hereby appointed as substitute counsel for Robert T. Flynn, pursuant to Rule 42-18, in the matter of the estate of Annie Hulme pending in the Probate Court of the City of Pawtucket, Probate number 21299.

attorneys: Frank A. Carter, Jr., Chief Disciplinary Counsel, Barrington, for petitioner.
Joseph B. Carty, Providence, for respondent.
casebody.head_matter:
The DISCIPLINARY BOARD OF the SUPREME COURT OF RHODE ISLAND, Petitioner, v. Robert T. FLYNN, Respondent.
No.80-230-M.P.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
May 30, 1980.
Frank A. Carter, Jr., Chief Disciplinary Counsel, Barrington, for petitioner.
Joseph B. Carty, Providence, for respondent.
